title: "The Cosmic Force and Ancient Medicine: Understanding Human Magnetism"
first_phrase: In the previous text, the concept of the operative cosmic force and its expression in the human body was introduced. This force is represented through a fluid that shapes the human magnetism. In this last part, the author clarifies the relationship between matter and energy based on Einstein's equation E=mc2. The author also discusses the complex composition of the human body, where subtle bodies vibrate at different rates and influence our existence. Furthermore, the author expands on the concept of the "Je," which is the instantaneous sum of all our experimental incarnations that exist in the present moment. The author also talks about Gurdjeff's description of the "State of Objective" that exists outside of time and destiny. Additionally, the text explores the roots of ancient Greek medicine and its incorporation into the author's methodology, inspired by the philosophy and scientific inquiry of the sixth and fifth centuries BCE.

Ainsi, nous nous rapprocherons sans cesse de « l’Etat Objectif » si bien décrit par Georges Gurdjeff. Comme nous l’avons expliqué précédemment, cet « Etat » est hors du temps et par conséquent en dehors du karma ou de la destinée. 5/ Magnétisme humain et Médecine Antique La médecine ancienne grecque puise ses racines chez les mésopotamiens. Très habilement, elle s’imprègne de la notion causale et duelle de notre existence en y rajoutant une nuance d’interdépendance. C’est pour cela qu’elle fait partie de notre méthode. Elle provient des VIème et Vème siècles avant notre ère. A cette époque, l’humanisme philosophique et la recherche scientifique battaient leur plein. Les philosophes exploraient la science, l’ingénierie et la médecine. Il fallait comprendre, décoder et innover.
last_phrase: In conclusion, by understanding and working towards putting our disruptive minds at bay, we can approach the objective state where we are free from the limitations of time, karma, and destiny. Additionally, the ancient Greek medicine, with its holistic approach, can guide us towards restoring the interdependence and causality of our existence in the universe, providing us with a practical and balanced way of viewing our place in the world.
